meta.content: Creating a self-directed Montessori learning environment in which children build a foundation of knowledge essential for a lifetime of learning while developing bi-literacy in English and Spanish.
Creating a self-directed Montessori learning environment in which children build a foundation of knowledge essential for a lifetime of learning while developing bi-literacy in English and Spanish.

LAMB is temporarily closed for students. If you need to reach us, please call 202-726-6200 between the hours of 9:00 am - 3:00 pm weekdays.
In addition to DCPS schools providing meals ( https://dcps.dc.gov/coronavirus), PCSB has a link to the DC Charter Schools providing meals to all DC students - https://dcpcsb.org/citywide-meal-distribution-all-students.
LAMB est\u00E1 temporariamente cerrado para alumnos. Si necesita comunicarse con nosotros por favor llame al 202-726-6200 de lunes a viernes durantes las horas de 9:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.
Adem\u00E1s de las escuelas de DCPS que proporcionan comidas (https://dcps.dc.gov/coronavirus), PCSB tiene una lista de escuelas Charter que proporcionan comidas a todos los estudiantes de DC: div.h2: Fostering Independent and Bilingual Lifelong Learners.

figure.class: sqs-block-image-figure image-block-outer-wrapper image-block-v2 design-layout-overlap combination-animation-fade-in individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none image-position-left image-linked

img.alt: Who We Are - LAMB PCS (Latin American Montessori Bilingual Public Charter School) is the only Spanish-language immersion Montessori school in D.C. We are one of just a handful of such schools in the U.S. We educate PreK3 through 5th grade students from all D.C. wards and backgrounds. LAMB has three locationsâtwo in Brightwood (NW, Ward 4), and one in Brookland (NE, Ward 5).Learn More

div.p: LAMB PCS (Latin American Montessori Bilingual Public Charter School) is the only Spanish-language immersion Montessori school in D.C. We are one of just a handful of such schools in the U.S. We educate PreK3 through 5th grade students from all D.C. wards and backgrounds. LAMB has three locationsâtwo in Brightwood (NW, Ward 4), and one in Brookland (NE, Ward 5).

div.h2: âThe greatest gifts we can give our children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence.â
div.p: LAMBâs mission has two parts. We want to instill a love of learning in our students at the same time that we help them become fluent in both English and Spanish. To achieve both these goals, we use the Montessori curriculum and do dual-language immersion, in which we teach in English and Spanish.Â Â

LAMB follows the Montessori model of mixing children who are close in age together in multi-age communities (classrooms). This structure lets students experience being part of the youngest, middle, and oldest group in a community. Each of these experiences help students grow. We have a program for each of these clusters :

LAMB has nine Primary communities serving students ages three to six.
Â
LAMB has eight Lower Elementary communities serving students ages six to nine.

LAMB has five Upper Elementary communities serving students ages nine to twelve.
Â
In addition, LAMB offers before and after school care for a fee.

img.alt: Preparing for a Successful Individual Education Plan Meeting

div.a: Preparing for a Successful Individual Education Plan Meeting

div.p: This Spring, many parents and guardians at LAMB, will be invited to meetings to discuss their children's Individual Education Plans (IEPs). Here we share a few tips for a successful IEP team meeting.

a.data-title: My New Journey as a Montessori Teacher

img.alt: My New Journey as a Montessori Teacher

div.a: My New Journey as a Montessori Teacher

div.p: At the end of the last school year, I accepted a new challenge and decided to train to become a Montessori teacher. I completed my training over the summer at the Montessori Training Center in Monterrey, Mexicoâ¦ I learned a lot over the summer and discovered a new world in every new material I learned how to use. Montessori materials are related to each other in a scientific and cosmic way. I love teaching students with these materials.Â
